thread.title: Trump promises tax cuts, 'rudiments' of new healthcare plan by December
thread.title_full: Trump promises tax cuts, 'rudiments' of new healthcare plan by December | Washington Examiner

author: Anna Giaritelli
title: Trump promises tax cuts, 'rudiments' of new healthcare plan by December

organizations.name: department of health and human services

text:
President Trump expects the government will be able to implement promised tax cuts for Americans by the end of 2017 in addition to a basic foundation for an Obamacare replacement.
In a pre-taped interview that aired on Fox News Monday evening, host Bill O'Reilly asked trump if the public can expect tax cuts in his first 11 months in office.
"I think so, yes. And I think before the end of the year, yes," Trump said.
O'Reilly asked if Americans can also expect to see a replacement to the soon-to-be-repealed Affordable Care Act by late December. Trump said his administration is "in the process," but that it may not take place until "sometime into next year."
Stay abreast of the latest developments from nation's capital and beyond with curated News Alerts   news desk and delivered to your inbox.
  Washington Examiner News Alerts.   alert soon! Trump said "by the end of the year, at least the rudiments" will be in place.
Currently, nine Republicans have offered replacement bills for Obamacare. Rep. Tom Price, R-Ga., has been nominated as secretary of the Department of Health and Human Services.
In regard to taxes, Trump promised to lower corporate taxes as well as those for the lower middle class. He has also vowed benefits for American corporations who bring manufacturing plants back to the U.S. from abroad.
Top Story Congress probing Secret Service agent who wouldn't take 'a bullet' for Trump Lawmakers did not specifically mention the Secret Service's own investigation into O'Grady's Facebook post.
